values:
Ugh.  Studying for the ACMT tests is the poo.

I've been accepted to graduate school at NCSU.  Yay.  I think I'm going to defer my admission for a year though, and save up some money.  Take some general classes at the CC.  Classes like... Spanish.  So I know a useful language, instead of Sign.  Cause lets face it.  They don't write journals in ASL.  

 I can't decide if this is a good idea or not, but my employer is investing a great deal of money in me in the next couple of weeks, and I feel I should stick so they get their moneys worth.  

Blah.  Back to the books (or rather the website lol)

Hadley's Hot & Spice Sunflower Seeds.  Amazing.

Let's talk about deodorant.  Seriously cool stuff.  Especially when mixed in with an antiperspirant.  Fuck all its an amazing invention.  So when is it OK not be wearing this amazing invention?  Never.  And yet, people do.  I understand forgetting maybe once or twice a year, say if you're late and in a rush etc.  But there is no excuse to come to work every day with stains on your shirts.  Gross.  Antiperspirant.  Amazing.

Craisins are the shit too.  

So, I was planning on going to the SAA's this year, which if you don't know are sorta a big deal for archaeologists.  Sadly, I have no money to fly to Atlanta, live in a hotel for 5 days and still manage to feed myself, pay rent, etc.  This bothers me.  I feel some legislation should be passed along the lines of, if your a student it's 75% off everything, no matter what, no matter where.  

In other news, iLife '09.  Amazing.  Faces however, is useless.  Apparently I am my friend Frederick, he is my english friend Madeleine and she is my sister, Annie.  Yeah.  There's some improvements that need to happen there.  The Garageband guitar lessons are interesting, except I've really lost my interest in learning how to play.  

So, lets talk about iPod's.  specifically the iPod touch, and it's sister product, the iPhone.  Amazing devices, these.  Expensive as hell, but also a device that you really can't live without once you have one.  So why, pray tell, would anyone take an iPhone near a pool, in the shower, or otherwise watery location, proceed to dump the phone in a liquid, and then expect the warranty to cover said external damage?  What the hell kind of warranty covers you fucking up your product?  Accidental damage protection like you get at Best Buy, sure, but its NOT a warranty.  Manufacturing defects, that is what a warranty is for.  None of this, you're a fucktard and took your obscenely expensive phone into the SHOWER with you cause you can't bear to not be texting for 5 freaking minutes, and now you expect me to have your phone fixed?  You can't fix stupid.  It's just not possible with current technology being what it is.  I find these people vaguely offensive.  They find me vaguely offensive to hehehe.  

With that said, having said for sure nothing of import, I bid you all a good day, week, month or whatever unit of time you wish.  Except a picosecond.  Fuck those.

Holy crap.  I have no idea what to do with myself.  I have a job until I leave for Carriacou on July 3rd... a trip with several layovers including a 12 hour one in Dallas (oh yay).

In other news.  Phoenix is hot as hell.  I'm choosing the graduate schools I will be applying to this fall.  I'm totally picking based on weather.  UC Santa Barbara is my holy crap I want to go there school.  I may apply to Stanford just cause if you get accepted you get 5 years guaranteed financial aid.  University of Tennessee in Knoxville of course... the body farm.  Maybe North Carolina State, cause I will be working with several of their staff this summer at my field school.  Also, Texas State in San Marcos.  It's going to be a busy fall.  I have no idea how to write a Statement of Objectives... or a Letter of Intent, whichever they want.  

I'm taking my last Sign Language class right now... makes me sad, because I haven't found a school that offers more advanced classes.  I'd like to learn more and maybe try translating, but I need to focus on Anthropology or I'll become a wandering scholar for the rest of my life.  I've been kicking around some ideas as to the region I want to focus on in graduate research... I have decided the Andean archaeological cultures are most interesting, especially prior to the rise of the Inka.  gasp, yep there are lots of interesting things before the Inka, who knew?  

I'm at work... I need to go do... work things.  Like checking my email, swapping lies and discussing the state of the union.

Two more finals and I'm done!  This is good, because tonight is the biannual anthropology pub crawl.  It will be my very last one :-(  Also, commencement is tomorrow, and convocation is Friday.  0_o  I get to wear a stupid looking gown and walk across a stage to receive, not my degree but a useless piece of paper.  Great.  

In other news, at the beginning of this semester I purchased a road bike!  I have been riding it rather faithfully at least 3 times a week... Now, over the first part summer I have decided to commute with it to work and back with it.  It shall be interesting.  It's roughly a 15 mile trip, so it's not to bad.  

Ack, I'm almost late for my doctors appt.  I'm finding out how I'm going to deal with being allergic to shell fish while living on an island for half the summer hahaha.

I finally got to go to Star Trek: The Experience in Las Vegas... woo!


The borg queen tried to assimilate me!  I said NO to assimilation.  Seriously it was awesome.  I highly recommend it if you get the chance.  And also, I wanna go to the Las Vegas Star Trek Convention even more now...

I moved!  No more moron roomate from hell!  It's awesome, right now my room is all my own because the other guy moved out the day before I moved it.  It's possilble I will be roomate free to the end of the semester!  In other news, Human Growth and Development test on Monday... I have to go study
and I had to turn a round and go back to take this picture because it's funny

Watch Freedom Writers people.  I just got back from seeing it with my roomates and friends.  It is awesome.

*sigh* my roomates are planning these awesome spring breaks... but I wont be able to go cause they all involve a lot of money :-(
so... we watched an autopsy today in Forensic Anthropology.  It was interesting.  And faster than one might think.

Buwahahaha  I love being an Anthropology Major with only two semester left before me!  So I'm taking Forensic Anthropology, Human Growth and Development, Cultural Anthr, and Spanish.  It's a toss up between the Forensic A. and Human G&D for favorite teacher of the semester... they are both hilarious.  They may even compete with Barb to ursurp her place as best teacher ever.

With that said, my roomate is still a moron, work is still meeeh, and there are STILL no flying cars.  

Hope everyone's doing great.  

I have a $25 Barnes and Noble gift certificate and I have no idea what to spend it on... this is a new experience for me. 0_o

http://www.jetprogramme.org/e/index.html

I'm doing that before I start graduate school.  I think it's an amazing opportunity.  I'm glad there are things like it out in the world.  It makes me happy.

So, I've decided to go out amongst the populace of Anthropology Ph.D recipients and interview them to see if I would like to focus in something similar to them.  So far I have the following ideas...

Dr. F who is a forensic anthropologist, a subject with which I am most fascinated
Dr. R who focuses on human origins and paleoecology, also fascinating
Dr. B who studies Bioarcheology and human osteology.  

I have some more but these people are the ones who focus in areas I am interested in studying and probably teaching.  

So I have a question for all you out there...  How does one go about interviewing a person to find out if what they are specialized in, and what they do for a living, is something you want to do?  

The only person I have ever interviewed is a funeral home director in Huntsville, and the questions I had were given to me by my instructor in Death and Dying: A Cross Cultural Perspective.  

Any ideas?  I mean, I have some obvious questions, like do you like what you do and all those ones, but is there anything any of you wish you had asked someone you interviewed about your potential future, something you thought of after the fact?  Or even a little bit of advice about interviews in general?  I'm socially inept!  Thanks if you do!

in other news, I just found out that they will for SURE be offering MAT 452 Intro to Chaos and Nonlinear Dynamics next fall.  I can't wait 0_o

So, we're in class today, talking about the order primates, how the order originated, the Arboreal Theory, the Visual Predation theory, etc. And we were talking about birthing styles in primates.  My instructor:  "So, we only have one baby at a time, commonly, all primates are this way, with the exception of some smaller ones, we don't have litters the way your cat has 6 kittens, or the way your dog has 8 kittens."  To which there is a low grumbling of laughter in us chilluns in the audience.  When she finally realized what she had said, she goes "imagine what a surprise that would be for you watching... Imagine what a surprise it would be for your dog!"  to which we were all laughing quite uproariously.  It was funny.  I suppose you just had to be there lol.  Best class session ever.  She's a cool professor.  A little strict, but cool.

I uploaded a new user pic.  First in a while.  Me building hot air balloons at Space Camp for the first time in 2 years.  You know what's sad?  I could still do it blind.

I should really check this more often.  I'm not even really all that busy.  I go to school 5 days a week for a couple hours.. work for the rest until 5, go to some school districts and videotape some teachers being confused, and then come home and study for Japanese.  really.  
However I also have nothing to write. Because, as seen in my 'schedule' above, NOTHING DIFFERENT EVER HAPPENS.  

in other news, sesame sticks and peanut butter = the best snack ever

and Peter F. Hamilton is my favorite author ever.

So... School is in full swing... Japanese is interesting... masochistic... but interesting.  My Anthro classes are amazing.  I love Osteology...I could do without learning so much about DNA though... boooring.  

hmm... so... Peanut butter and sesame sticks from Whole Foods are the best snack ever.  

I need better study habits.  Currently I have god knows what for Japanese plus some things I remember her telling us are due Monday... a Biological Anthropology test on Monday...covering Primatology, Human Osteology, DNA, Evolutionary Theory, and some random shit from the rest of the book.  It is my favorite class though.  :-D  

I am being forced to swim laps tomorrow.  0_o  I know it's good for me... but... sigh

In other news... I love the sheer abundance of people at ASU... Sitting waiting for class to start is never boring, there's always people to watch.  It amuses me greatly.  Even though I hate being around lots of people.  I need to do laundry, but I'm lazy.  FYI Part 10 of From The Earth To The Moon is the greatest piece of documentary video on the face of the planet, i highly recommend it.  and Peter F. Hamilton is now on my list of good authors.  

jaa, mata

I've been...not updating lol.  It's what happens when you go back to Space Camp... It's a black hole.  And it's not happening again... I HAVE to find something else to do in the summertime. Some other way to make a little money.  turns out Sam and Dave got together and made up a lie about me to get me on the "Do not re-hire" list... so, yeah... HR made a mistake and I wasn't supposed to be there at all this summer.  *wicked grin*  

It was still fun though... All the cool people I get to hang out with and call my friends... I miss them :-(  They make camp hell worth it.  

So... in other news... I've finally decided that math and physics and all that jazz is just not my cup of tea.  I'm majoring in Anthropology (with an emphasis in Physical Anthropology) and I graduate next fall.  yay.  then I start graduate school somewhere (hopefully University of Tennessee - Knoxville or ASU).  So yeah... This is the first semester without math or physics...it's kinda nice.  

Japanese was probably a stupid mistake as far as choosing a foreign language (given I live in the southwest) but it's masochistically fun.  :-D

I've got to get back to studying.

space camp still sucks.  word to the wise: stay away.  after spending 400 dollars to get here they remove me from advanced... the managers all "i didn't know it meant so much to you" when i was like...i would have appreciated a phone call to tell me this before hand.  but no, obviously i mean jesus.  i have so much to say about this but not enough time to write it all.  by the way they've pretty much raped advanced...even the 12 day isn't half of what the normal camp used to be.  they just trained any idiot they could find for advanced, and they don't know half as much as most of the kids already know.  it's pathetic really.  it makes me sad.  an awesome program, lay in ruins.

yaaaayyyy!!  The Mac is officially back in business!!  A new hd!  and *drum roll* Tiger!!!  I have the coolest school.  The way you get Tiger is awesome.  I have a contract and for 70 dollars i get Tiger and any upgrades Apple dishes out until March of 2008!!  that means when the next feline animal upgrade comes out...i get it free :-D    oh glorious day!

I'm going back to Space Camp.  It's confirmed.  :-D

my laptop is breaking.  which sucks cause i have to take an internet class whilst im at camp...and i sorta need my laptop.  i need a paper clip and some string...ill improvise a firewire cable to save my data off my laptop and then ill beg Apple to fix it.  but they probably won't.  the bitches.  im going to the apple store.  later ya'll

Meeh  Now that I'm done bitching about life the universe and everything.  Fudgeshop Grasshoppers and not an acceptable substitute for Thin Mints.  

I have to go read some Japanese Literature now, and pretent that I care enough about it to write mini informative posts on my class forum.  good night all

So.  Been a while.  Hi y'all.  anyway.  

I pre-registered for my fall '06 classes.  I'm taking:  Russian, Linear Alg, DiffEQ, Studies in Linguistics, and Buried Cities, Lost Tribes.  FUN!!  

I get to take a 5 week end of semester course this semester called "Storms and Culture"  I can't wait.  It shall be fun.  Then on top of that, I'm taking a required English Lit class over the internet this summer whilst I am at Space Camp (presuming they hire me).  It's going to be...interesting.   

Lyn and her mom came out to visit and look at ASU...Lots of fun.  got some cool pictures I'll post when I get around to it.  

My sister and her family are leaving for the weekend.  I'm going to get quietly drunk on Jack and Coke.  And study like mad for a Chem test.  

bleh i was looking for a good quote to put here but I can't find it.  It's from a Philip K Dick book.  Damn.  I'll find it.  goodnight.

so...I am moving into the dorms next fall.  And I was supposed to have recieved a letter telling me what dorm I am in.  but i haven't  Maybe...they are going to put me on the new cardboard box on Mill Ave.  I heard a rumor it got upgraded... Type 4 recyclable plasic cardboard!  sweet!  lol im not really worried though.

In other news.  I think I am going to take my one 200 level class left to me on the internet next summer whilst I am at camp.  Its just a writing about literature required class...so im not expecting it to be that difficult.  Mainly because i want to add something fun to my schedule.  I was thinking thinking Intermediate Creative writing...but its division is Poetry, and fiction...no non-fiction which is what i sorta wanted.  boo.  anyway.  life is pretty good im almost caught up with homework!  later all!!

hmmm.  Anyone know how bad it would be if I took Applied Linear Algebra and DiffEQ in the same semester?  

in other news, I'm writing an essay thats kicking my butt.  and I am up 4 hours past my bedtime!  Does that mean I'm dedicated?  no..cause the majority of that time was spent trying to teach a friend how to play Starcraft (not unsucessfully I might add).  

hmmm.  Chemistry is fun.  But I have a test friday and when test's are involved NO subject is fun.  Why do teachers have to fuck up perfectly good and interesting subjects with tests?  sheesh, they ruin everything :-P

im going to take a Zyrtec and go to sleep now.  I hope you all are having fun whereever you are.  May the road rise up to mean you, and all that jazz (ooh good song).  night!

so i picked up my physics book and was reading it.  damnit there is some neato stuff in there.  i may have to try to take it from another teacher.  but im still doing english linguistics.  and maybe mathing minor.  I get to take Chaos and Nonlinear Dynamics!!!

So...now that I'm no longer in Physics...and I'm a English - Linguistics major...im thinking of taking a minor in Mathematics.  I can't make school easy on myself after all.  Besides...for Linguistics I have to be fluent to the 400 level in a foreign language...so I have three years left at ASU anyway...which means empty space on a schedule that must have more than 12 credit hours a semester on it.  :-D  And I only have to take 3 more classes to get the minor (lol)  But i want to know something...is any math harder than Calc 3?  cause i mean...not only did you have to do math...you had to be a fucking artist on top of it...I'm going to avoid art classes...cause...I have no arting skill.

I'm offically not a Physics major anymore.  I'm offically not in Physics class anymore too.  I feel weird.  and kinda sick.  

What does one do with a degree in English - Linguistics anyway?  I need a minor.  grrr.

hmm okay.  is it a bad sign that i go to a school where the 24 people in my Physics 150 class will be the 24 people I graduate with?  My prof. told us yesterday that they only graduate about 24-26 physics majors a year.  wtf?  So to all you out there who've had the wonderful experience of Physics labs, were yours vague like mine are?   theyre like...here use this sensor and measure that...with absoulutly no instructions as to how to do it...and when you ask my proffessor or the TA both are like..uhh i don't know i've never done this lab.  grrr  English Linguistics is decided upon as my concurrent degree thing...but Physics is definitly on the list of things to think carefully through during the summer before pre-reg.  

On the class front..Japanese Literature in Translation is really cool.  My prof is crazy!!!  we have like...6 novels to read and the anthology...its a hellish amount of reading...especially since "The Tower and the Hive," Anne McCaffrey, is waiting for me...but it looks like it will be summer before I get to read it.  

History 110 US history from 1865 to the present kinda sucks.  we have to read this book and Edison that is written so poorly that my eyes want to jump out and kill the author, and to top it all of its like...Bible print and big.  grrr it was supposed to have been read by last week...oops... :-D

hmm...Physics...grrrr

Chemistry...suprisingly...easy... a we bit o' memorization...and some basic algebra skills...and its kinda fun.  I have test tomorrow and much memorization to do 8-/  damn polyatomic ions and their charges are gonna be the death of me.  but acids...now those bitches are fun...

I have applied to go back to Space Camp in the summer.  They will make decisions sometime in April, i was told... I caused a lot of trouble there over Christmas Camp...so im not sure i'll be welcomed back :-|   oh well.

ok...so Einstein is back in my good graces...but only because he said this:  "Teaching should be such that what is offered is   
perceived as a valuable gift and not as a hard duty"                                              
- Albert Einstein
(03/14/1879-1955)

and i used it in my signature when i sent a message to my physics instructor *wicked grin*

so...if I drop Physics...and take up Anthropology...what exacly do I do with it when i am finished?  like...physics is...people have jobs doing physics and theres a demand for it...is there a demand for anthropologists?  wtf i mean...is it like majoring in literature or something that just means your an unemployed person or a teacher? grrr

ok so now that were doing chapter 1...instead of chapter 37...physics isn't so bad.  I still don't think its going to be my major though.  anyway.  tons of homework this weekend.  but im determined to finish most of it today. cause i want the weekend to sleep and frag.  

I wore my NASA shirt around today...hoping someone would acknowledge the fact that it was an important 20th anniversary for NASA.  but no one did. but on my drive home yesterday the radio announcer on the country station was like I'd like to honor these people and he named them all and everything.  it was awesome even if it was on the wrong day.  i think im doing to send him a free lunch to somewhere or something.  sadness

i swear to god i will never like einstein anymore.  if i meet him down in hell when i die im gonna kill him again just for good measure.  grrrr.  (makes angry face)

I have calmed down some.  Enough to not just walk away from the class at least.  though tomorrow is our 'first' class since my very sarcastic email to the professor reguarding clarity in writing.  :-D  I hope he says something...im in the mood for a good row.  I am most definitly changing my major though.  I can't go through this for the next 2 years.  im thinking Antrhopology(Linguistics) and Global Studies...concurrent majors... not sure what career i'd have with an education like that though...but at least life would be interesting!  anyway I must go to a school district and videotape the teachers being taught to be better teachers.  :-D  muhahhaha theres something insanely satisfying in watching teachers be students...just so long as im not the one teaching them!  hehehe

death to inane instructions!!!
is a "w" neccessarily a BAD thing on a transcript?

So...once again I've come across a subject I can't stand.  Apparently this is to be something of a regular event in my life.  As many of you know Physics is my chosem major, well was my chosem major.  However prior to this semester I have never taken physics in my life.  Yeah yeah, i know it was probably stupid of me to choose a subject like that to major in, but really, it sounds interesting from the outside.  and then you get stuck with these fucking labs, that have nothing to do with what your talking about in lecture, and yet your responsible to know this lab shit, that you haven't been taught.  GOOOOODDDD DAAAAMMMMMNNIIITTTTT I'm sick of the bullshit and inconsistency that goes on in the realm of science.  I'm switching to Anthropology, Linguistics.  maybe ill do both.  
I almost walked out of physics today i was shaking pissed.  like...Lyn remembers how pissed I was when dad was like omg your watching gothic satanism, pissed.  here were are...starting in chapter 37 of the bloody Physics I book, Special Relativity...which...i dont give a shit about.  and were doing some math...and then all of the sudden he's like okay group work here's a problem from Physics II.  WHAT THE HELL?!!!  At the very least give us something useful god damnit.  damnit damnit damnit.  damnit.  we never get lab explanations more than whats required to be able to use the fucking vernier calipers...cause its not like i knew how to use those.  so.  i may actually even drop it.  I can't put up with this bullshit all semester long.  I have to meet with my lab group to write the lab report for our first lab.  which has nothing to do with anything we will be discussing for another oh 13 weeks.  S 'ok tho...cause I've taken enough english classes to bullshit my way through anything.  

GOD DAMNIT.  Fuck school.  at least i know i like Anthro and Ling.  I like Literature too.  I can be smart and major in a non-science.  thats allowed.  right?

Muhahahaahaha Finals are OVER!!!  I have a terrible grade in Calculus, but I passed and its the last math class I have to take, until grad school probably...gag.  I probably have a terribly grade in Music, Jazz in America, because...no im sorry i didn't think it was important for me to do as the study guide suggested:  "Thoroughly read the book"  No shit...thats all his study guide said.  Memorize everything in the fucking book and ur ready to take my final.  the bitch.  

on a happier note, i found out my cousin who just moved to california works at a ski resort *huge wicked grin*

*frown* on a sad note, children are still being created and born every day...I ask you people what for?  we should be ridding the world of these menacing and vile monetary black holes, and while were at it...lets take the ho ho ho fellow out too....

Excerpt from America's Army;

Spacernerd12 was show by ITALIANSTALLION1

to which she promptly says:  "Fuck you Italian Stallion, he's probably not even hot"

I was greatly amused.

ps Alan Dean Foster:  Lost and Found...is a really good book.  by a local arizona author no less!

I don't know why i did this one:

He loves travel, excitement, and a good archaeological discovery. He hates Nazis and snakes, perhaps to the same degree. He always brings along his trusty whip and fedora. He's tough, cool, and dedicated. He relies on both brains and brawn to get him out of trouble and into it.

well that entertained me for aproximatly, 12.853 seconds. so...spent 3 and a half hours doing a math test on Thursday...i can't decide if that's good or bad...Tests usually never take over an hour for me. i'm worried. anyway. my brothers girlfriend had a baby (his), a girl. 4 pounds, 13 ounces and 17 inches long. premee for sure. mom had kidney infection but is fine. we are having Baby BBQ (my family's style of a baby shower...but guy friendly cause...ladies can't BBQ :-P ) tomorrow. anyone of you is welcome to come. just bring food. :-D

So...at the behest of a friend I've been watching these military shows...its pretty interesting.  and it made me think of something that happened when I was coming back from Advanced Space Academy in 2001...like...8 or 9 days after 9/11...I'd almost forgot about it.  It was the return trip of my first airplane flight and I was, once again, stuck in the Houston airport over night...I was sitting in those wicked chairs just waiting for the night to pass...freezing my ass off...I was wearing my light blue flight suit, and my space camp sweater over top...I must of looked funny as hell... anyway I had my Pilot dog tags (for those of you who don't know there used to be an award for the pilot track that was the dog tags...it was GNC I think) on and this guy in the Army or Marines (at the time I had no clue what the difference was so...lol) came over and talked to me for a while...he thought I was in some branch of the military, but I was like..noo....I'm just a nerd.  I was pretty nervous...first time away from home an all...first time airplane trips...9/11 having been the week before...I had no social skills...I picked up all the ones I do have working at Space Camp so...that tells yah something.  It was also the first time I had ever seen a real uniformed military person...ouside of movies.  I was probably rude...not intentionally but I didn't know how to talk to people back then...I still have trouble with it.  but..I dunno...it was nice to have a person around who made me feel like the airport was safe.  and he was really nice...I think he sat with me for an hour or two.  I don't remeber they guys name...or rank or anything...but here's to hoping he's still all right and not dead...

So...Spent three beautifully Satan free days at my other sisters house in town this weekend...no internet...thought i was going to lose my mind...but...without Satan there it wasn't so bad.  Watched StarTrek Nemesis...good times from camp...lol...Hitchhikers Guide...just good...Apollo 13...just damn good.  It was nice...did some homework...writing a paper for history connecting Apollo 13 with Ernest Shackleton's ill fated journey to the Antarctic...gonna be cool!!  its due thursday...i have like...5 sentences...awesome.  Calc 3 is still the second worst bane of my existance.  Music Jazz in America is by far the worst.  teacher is an ASSHOLE.  chewed some girl out today and told she was acting like a 3rd grader and that this was college and thats not appreciated and what not...she made a joke all of the other 250 students got it...but the idiot teacher was like...i have a stick up my ass and i don't know how to teach so im gonna pretend your all in high school and treat you as such.. i swear to god if that mother (beep) ever points that idiotic attidude toward me he's in for it.  class is sooooo freaking boring.  any way home all is well everyone...here's to your jack-o-lantern guarding your house from the spirits of the 'eve.

I dislike halloween.  it sucks.  my sister is way to enthusiastic about it...im going to snap at her and damage my familial relationships.  i dont care.  she's the one with the children from hell.  she's the one who gives them ice cream at 8pm so they can't say they didn't get a fucking desert.  if im ever rich and discover mob connections...oh the possibilities.  jesus god i hate these two children.

anyway...in other news...i am Registered for the following:
General Biology I
General Chemistry I
and Physics I

...im not sure what this is going to be like..as i have never had a class in any of the three subjects.  If you think i am biting off more than i can chew...please let me know...other wise i will likely be an inner city bum the rest of my life.  

in other news...on top of the 12 credit hours that those three classes make up, i want to take an 8 credit out EMT-B class.  however given that i think those evil 12 are going to tip my sanity off the fine knife edge it is already on...i probably should forgo the EMT thing.  gaaaah

ok...so i've been ordered to update... apparently someone is fascinated with my very exciting life ;-D

So, here's the news.  I am newly employed as of today actually, i work for the Center for Research on Education in Science, Math, Engineering, and Technology as a Computer Support Assistant.  Its pretty fun actually.  I'm used to working around educators, so its not like its much of a switch...and the network at ASU is actually designed the proper way so I don't have to deal with the crazy problems we had at CVS.  Anyway, thats work.  yay. 

I get to go get American Heart Association CPR Certified tomorrow.  Yippe.  I've decided to take EMT-B classes at the community college next semester...yes im moonlighting on ASU...so all of you who read that and went omg he went back to community college can just chill.  I figure i can work weekends only as an EMT...and then my week will be full of school...bloody weekends...scholary weekdays...it sounds like it would fit my personality anyway....  he he he.  And if y'all don't like it blame Lyn...she made me do it. 

In the news this week I have a Calc 3 test and a Music-Jazz in America test AND a Linguistics test next week.  So I'm going to go study (read: watch tv)  later y'all....

P.S. I might go to Space Camp next summer...just cause.
